Planning, IR & Government Relations [142] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Yes, this is Garry Peiffer again. As you probably know, this is an undivided interest in this pipeline, so there's three owners and we're all competing with one another to set tariffs and to ship volume, so we have to be a little bit careful about how we talk about the pipelines. So the bottom line is we're just one of three and we have to evaluate this in our interest, but we don't control the ultimate destiny of that line. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Evan Calio, Morgan Stanley - Analyst [143] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Got it. Last small question from me is can you give any color on the pretax income that comes from the acquired GasAmerica stores? I will leave it at that. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gary Heminger, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - President, CEO [144] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- We have not given that level of detail, nor have we closed the transaction yet. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Evan Calio, Morgan Stanley - Analyst [145] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All right guys, again, great quarter. Thanks for taking my call. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gary Heminger, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - President, CEO [146] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Thank you very much. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Operator [147] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Chi Chow, Macquarie Capital. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Chi Chow, Macquarie Research - Analyst [148] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Hey, Don, real quick, what is the remaining CapEx on DHOUP and also have you given any guidance on 2013 CapEx? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Don Templin, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - SVP, CFO [149] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- We have not given guidance on 2013 CapEx. Remaining CapEx on DHOUP was $370 million for the year. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Chi Chow, Macquarie Research - Analyst [150] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- As of the end of first quarter? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Don Templin, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - SVP, CFO [151] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- No, I don't know that number from the end of the first quarter. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Chi Chow, Macquarie Research - Analyst [152] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Okay, so $370 million at the beginning of the year? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Don Templin, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - SVP, CFO [153] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $370 million was the full year. That was included in our full-year refining CapEx budget, Chi. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Chi Chow, Macquarie Research - Analyst [154] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Okay, great. Thanks a lot. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Operator [155] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Rakesh Advani, Credit Suisse. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Rakesh Advani, Credit Suisse - Analyst [156] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Hi, I just had a quick last question. In the -- you mentioned about retail expansions. Would you be looking to move back into the Southeast in a big way? Would that be interesting to you? Or --? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gary Heminger, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - President, CEO [157] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Yes. We have stated before we are very interested in continuing to grow both sides of our retail. I want to make sure, when Paul Cheng was asking me about retail, we have the Marathon brand in the Southeast but we don't look at same-store sales in Marathon brand because we don't have the individual store volumes. But we have Speedway just in the Midwest, in the seven-state area. But certainly if we can find the quality and the size of opportunities, we would consider that into the Southeast for Speedway. We're continuing. We had an outstanding year last year on the Marathon brand side in growing our business in the Southeast as well. So, we're trying to grow both sides of our retail business. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Rakesh Advani, Credit Suisse - Analyst [158] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Thank you. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gary Heminger, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - President, CEO [159] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Yes. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Operator [160] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- That concludes today's question-and-answer session. Please go ahead with any final remarks. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Pam Beall, Marathon Petroleum Corporation - VP IR, Government & Public Affairs [161] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Thank you, Christine. Thanks to everyone for joining us today and for your interest in Marathon Petroleum. Should you have any additional questions this afternoon, the IR team will be in the office. Give us a call. Thank you. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Operator [162] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Thank you for participating in the Marathon Petroleum Corporation's first-quarter 2012 earnings conference call. This concludes the conference for today. You may all disconnect at this time.

Event.eventTitle: Q1 2012 Marathon Petroleum Corporation Earnings Conference Call
